en.name: CheyTac Intervention
en.description: The CheyTac Intervention also known as the CheyTac M200, is an American bolt-action sniper rifle manufactured by CheyTac USA, which can also be classified as an anti-materiel rifle. It is fed by a five-round detachable single-stack magazine. It is specifically chambered in either .408 Chey Tac ammunition. CheyTac Inc. states that the system is capable of delivering sub-MOA accuracy at ranges of up to 2,500 yd (2,286 m). It is based on the EDM Arms Windrunner.

en.name: Cheytac Wire Stock
en.description: The standard stock manufactured for the Cheytac Intervention. Push button on the left side of the bolt normally allows for adjustment of length of pull. It seems to be missing its stowable monopod.

en.name: Cheytac Super Lightweight Stock
en.description: A stock specially made with ultralight materials and strategically placed holes allows for faster manipulation of the weapon at the cost of recoil mitigation. Adjustable butt-pad and comb offer maximal ergonomics.

en.name: Cheytac Precision Stock
en.description: A stock made for those that are probably laying in dirt before taking their shots. Specially tuned weights placed throughout the stock along with a massive adjustable comb and butt-pad make this stock the premium choise for the precision shooter. Although it is a bit unweildy, this stock offers far and above the best recoil mitigation a stock could offer.

en.name: Cheytac Ergo Grip
en.description: An AR style pistol grip manufactured for the Cheytac Intervention. Although is is mostly a placeholder, this pistol grip mates quite well with the Intervention system.

en.name: 5-Round .408 Cheytac Magazine
en.description: A 5-round detachable box magazine for the Cheytac Intervention. Normally the Intervention comes with a 7-round magazine, but this is the only Intervention magazine that has been seen in the Norvinsk region. Whoever the previous owner was seems to have marked it with a trademark of sorts. Whether this was for 'morale', or to better locate dropped mags is up for debate.

en.name: Cheytac Brick Compensator
en.description: A very large compensator of unknown origin. It is well balanced and perfectly tuned.

en.name: Cheytac Helical Flash Hider
en.description: A 'small' Flash Hider with helical cuts on its body. A similar model can be found on really Epic NATO weapons. This one seems to have been made overly large specifically for the 408. Doesn't really do much to mitigate recoil or improve weapon manipulation.

en.name: Cheytac 'Unit' Muzzle Brake
en.description: An absolute unit of a Muzzle Brake. If the Norvinsk region had functioning car alarms, the concussion from this thing would probably set them off. Heavily mitigates recoil, and your ability to hear.

en.name: McArthur PGRS-1 Muzzle Brake
en.description: The standard Muzzle brake for the Cheytac. Looks like the younger sibling to the 'Unit' brake, though this one came first. It's quite heavy but reduces recoil well enough. Probably should be replaced ASAP.

en.name: Cheytac Suppressor and Brake
en.description: A monster of a full-bodied suppressor that curiously features a small muzzle brake. Not only reduces the noise signature of the Cheytac to a loud hiss, but greatly reduces recoil. The weight might be an issue however. Massive.

en.name: Cheytac OPSINC Wrapped Suppressor
en.description: A suppressor of medium size for the Cheytac. On it is a special heat wrap. This will not only prevent the user from accidentally burning themselves with the can, but also cuts any heat mirage from the suppressor making precision long-range shooting with an optic significantly easier.

en.name: Cheytac Extreme Precision Barrel
en.description: The longest barrel made for the Intervention, this behemoth of a barrel allows for the highest compression of gas behind the projectile and gives the projectile the longest contact-time possible with its rifling. Not for the feint of heart.

en.name: Cheytac Standard Length Barrel
en.description: The standard Intervention barrel, Free floating and quickly replacable, this barrel is perfectly weighted for harmonics and precision.

en.name: Cheytac CQB Barrel
en.description: A crazy person's barrel, although mildly inaccurate due to reduced rifling, it does make the weapon more operable in tight spaces. Somehow accepts all available Cheytac muzzle devices.

en.name: EDM Arms Windrunner Barrel
en.description: The Windrunner Barrel. Before a barrel shroud and carrying handle were added, the Intervention was known as the EMD Arms Windrunner. It was a somewhat crude testing prototype. A shroud and carryhandle were added for actual field use, this was a barrel specifically for ballistics testing. The large Barrel Nut can be twisted off for fast changing of the barrel. Integral Bipod is optimally placed at the rifle's center-of-gravity. Maybe someday someone will have the guts to deploy it.

en.name: Cheytac Floating Barrel Shroud
en.description: Independent of the barrel, this shroud acts like a handguard. Carry-handle mount point is strategically placed to offset the weight of the large barrel and whatever large optic might be placed ontop the reciever. The ring pin behind the carry handle can be pulled to unlock the shroud. The shroud is then rotated 45 degrees and slides over the barrel to access and change the barrel. Features a side pic rail for lights and lasers and a top pic rail for a range finder.

en.name: Cheytac Race Shroud
en.description: A shorter, optimally weighted alternative to the standard barrel shroud. This shroud was clearly made by and for those who want to clear rooms and hallways with an Intervention. It remains to be seen if this tactic is at all effective. Features a side pic rail for lasers and lights.

en.name: Windrunner Bipod
en.description: The other key piece in the old EDM Windrunner setup. Whoever put that odd sticker at the bottom of the box magazine has jury-rigged a Spartan Valhalla bipod into the carry-handle slot of the Intervention to emulate the old Windrunner look. If only a single soul in all of the Norvinsk Region could figure out how to use a bipod correctly.

en.name: Cheytac Bolt Handle
en.description: The standard bolt pull handle made for the Cheytac Intervention. Smells like Golden Star balm for some reason.

en.name: Cheytac Weighted Bolt Handle
en.description: An oversized bolt pull that is specially weighted. Made oversized for use with uncomfortable gloves, you'd have to try to fumble this thing in the heat of a firefight. Gives user better control of the weapon, but adds almost unnecessary weight.

en.name: Cheytac Skeletonised Bolt Handle
en.description: Yet another skeletonised weapon part. For those who need to squeeze efficiency and ergonomic value out of every ounce of their firearm. Race Gun Vibes.

en.name: Cheytac Carry Handle
en.description: Placed in such a spot so that when you lug this ridiculously heavy rifle around, it won't tip one way or the other. They really thought of everything, didn't they.

en.name: Cheytac Tied Carry Handle
en.description: A thin, slimmer version of the standard carry handle. Not great for holding while taking shots, but the paracord wrapped around it might help with faster target aquisition and cheek-weld.

en.name: Cheytac 'Stout'
en.description: Whoever made this saw a carry handle as an opportunity to place more weight at strategic positions of the rifle to reduce intertia of recoil. Maybe in their quest for making that next record-shattering shot they forgot how heavy this rifle already is.

en.name: .408 Cheyenne Tactical
en.description: The un-sung hero of the entire Intervention system. CheyTac specially developed the .408 CheyTac cartridge for long-range use. This cartridge is optimized for accuracy by a balance of the rotational and linear drag, which reduces yaw and precession, and keeps the tip of the projectile pointed along the trajectory. The Cheytac Intervention is fed through a detachable 5 round box magazine. Alternatively, cartridges can be loaded individually directly into the chamber. Stays supersonic out to ridiculous distances. Hits harder than a .50 cal at 1500 meters due to a near pefect ballistic coefficient/low drag. The best bullet ever devised by human hands.
